Package org.soen6441.model.orders

Class Airlift

java.lang.Object
org.soen6441.model.orders.Airlift
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, Order
public class Airlift
extends java.lang.Object
implements Order
Airlift class implements the Order interface and overrides the execute method. The object of this method is created when the player issues airlift order.
See Also:
Serialized Form

    The number of armies to be moved.
    private Player d_Player

    (package private) Country d_SourceCountry
    The Source Country from which the armies are to be moved to the target country.

    The Source Country from which the armies are to be moved to the target country.

  • Constructor Details

    • Airlift

      public Airlift​(Player p_Player, Country p_SourceCountry, Country p_TargetCountry, int p_NumArmies)
      Constructor of the class which is called when the new object of Airlift class is created.
      Parameters:
      p_Player - Player who issues the airlift order.
      p_SourceCountry - Country from which the airlift of armies should happen.
      p_TargetCountry - Country to which armies to be sent.
      p_NumArmies - Number of armies to be airlift from one country to another.

  • Method Details

    • execute

      public void execute()
      This method airlifts armies from one country to another country of the same player if order is valid. This method also removes the card airlift.
      Specified by:
      execute in interface Order

    • isValid

      public boolean isValid()
      This method checks for the validity of the Airlift order. Returns false if the source and target countries are same, player doesn't have airlift card. Return false if source country is not left with atleast one army.
      Returns:
      true if valid, else false.

    • getPlayer

      public Player getPlayer()
      This is the getter method to provide the player.
      Returns:
      player issuing the order

    • setPlayer

      public void setPlayer​(Player d_Player)
      This is the setter method to set the player name.
      Parameters:
      d_Player - Player for this order.
